    Android Connected to WiFi but No Internet Issue

    A troubleshooting guide for fixing the ‘connected to WiFi but no internet’ issue on Android devices, particularly when using randomized MAC addresses.

    less than 1 minute read

    1. Home
      2. /
    2. Android
      3. /
    3. Troubleshooting
      4. /
    4. Android Connected to WiFi but No Internet Issue

    Matthew Choo

    With 20 years in market research across Telco and Media, I’ve decoded consumer behavior, optimized research, and driven data-led strategies. Now, I’m diving into coding, automation, and tech solutions—where data meets efficiency. This blog is my space to share insights, from Python scripts to research optimizations and life hacks. Join me in exploring smarter ways to work and live!

    • Asia
    • Twitter
    • GitHub
    • Instagram
    • Email

    Suspected cause for my case:

    • Vivo android phone use “randomized MAC address” when connected to WiFi
    • My house have main router + mesh router
    • I do IP Binding with Mac address
    • Combination above caused the issue.

    Solution:

    1. On android, in respective connected WiFi setting, change Privacy to “Use device MAC” 

    2. Go to router > LAN > DCHP and remove any previous binding with your phone name
    3. Off Wifi on phone, go to another router, on wifi on phone, connect to it
    4. Fixed

    RegardsMatthew

    Tags: Android, MAC Address, No Internet, Router Settings, WiFi

    Categories: Android, Troubleshooting
